testlink.api.java.client.tc.autoexec
Class TestPlan

java.lang.Object
  testlink.api.java.client.tc.autoexec.TestPlan

public class TestPlan
extends java.lang.Object

The class is used to manage the execution of test cases associated with a test plan.

The test plan manager has two modes of opertaion. There is the online mode and the offline mode. In order to enter online mode a valid DEV KEY and TestLink API url must be provided. See the TestLink documentation for more information about the dev key.

If the api is deemed to be unreachable no error is thrown. The test plan manager just defaults into offline mode. The offline or online state of a TestPlanManager instance is found by using isOffline() method.

Author:
Daniel Padilla

TestPlan

public TestPlan(TestLinkAPIClient apiClient,
                java.lang.String projectName,
                java.lang.String planName)
When the TestPlanManager is instantiated then it retrieves all the test cases that are defined as automated test cases in the test plan.

Reporting of test results is turned on if the API is reachable. If the API is not reachable the system defaults to offline mode.

TestPlan

public TestPlan(java.lang.String projectName,
                java.lang.String planName,
                java.lang.String testCaseClass,
                java.lang.String devKey,
                java.lang.String urlToAPI)
When the TestPlanManager is instantiated then it retrieves all the test cases that are defined as automated test cases in the test plan.

The cases are instantiated using the class that is passed to the constructor.

Reporting of test results is turned on if the API is reachable. If the API is not reachable the system defaults to offline mode.

Parameters:
projectName -
planName -
testCaseImplementionClass -

putTestCase

public void putTestCase(TestCase testCase,
                        java.lang.String loginUserName)
                 throws TestLinkAPIException
Adds a test case to the a project test suite if the test case does not exist and then it it adds it to the test plan. If the test case exists it replaces the test case class obejct instance with the new instance.
